How to Install slib on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • slib

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install slib on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing slib on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall slib in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install slib, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install slib Using apt

To install slib in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install slib using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install slib

The installation of slib might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install slib Using apt-get

To install slib using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install slib.

sudo apt-get -y install slib

Install slib Using Synaptic

To install slib using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install slib on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for slib. This will display the slib package in the package window, now to install slib, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the slib package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of slib.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install slib Using aptitude

To install slib on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of slib.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install slib using the command aptitude install slib.

sudo aptitude -y install slib

How to Upgrade slib on debian

If you want to upgrade the slib package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade slib using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade slib to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade slib.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade slib sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade slib

Upgrade slib using Aptitude

To upgrade slib using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade slib.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade slib

Upgrade slib using Synaptic

To upgrade slib using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for slib, now right-click slib, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade slib just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall slib on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall slib from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just slib, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove slib

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of slib

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of slib you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge slib

Remove slib using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall slib using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for slib, right-click the slib package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall slib click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install slib on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade slib using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
